authorAttribution.displayName: Anne Hathaway did not spit in my food.

originalText.text: Took a mixology class for the first time, after enjoying many wine, spirits, and sake classes over the years. Mixing New Orleans spirits was very fun and enlightening with a great presenter and students.

text.text: Took a mixology class for the first time, after enjoying many wine, spirits, and sake classes over the years. Mixing New Orleans spirits was very fun and enlightening with a great presenter and students.

originalText.text: The founder’s elements of wine is my favorite class.

text.text: The founder’s elements of wine is my favorite class.

originalText.text: My first time attending a wine / food pairing / cooking class and I was very impressed.  The new facility is fabulous for this sort of thing - very comfortable seating, good amenities at each seat, well placed cameras to view the details of the cooking.  The chef instructor, Carl Raymond, was great - lots of fun and very knowledgable.  It was a terrific, instructive evening - with great food and wine.

text.text: My first time attending a wine / food pairing / cooking class and I was very impressed.  The new facility is fabulous for this sort of thing - very comfortable seating, good amenities at each seat, well placed cameras to view the details of the cooking.  The chef instructor, Carl Raymond, was great - lots of fun and very knowledgable.  It was a terrific, instructive evening - with great food and wine.

originalText.text:
Astor Center itself is an Amazing Venue. If I were to post a review about the Venue I would give it 5 stars.  My review is about the Fried & Fizzy event that was held at this venue.

The Tastings were amazing, The staff in charge of showing and explaining the Wine were extremely knowledgeable.  The Tasting (Fried) portion of the event was to say the least non existent. I was prepared to broaden my knowledge and tantalize my pallet with an assortment of chicken. That did not happen. There was a  cheese platter -which was nice but the advertisement says Fried Chicken.  I as well as many other guest were extremely disappointed. Hopefully the event planners will either change the advertisement or add Fried Chicken to the event in the future

The Tastings were amazing, The staff in charge of showing and explaining the Wine were extremely knowledgeable.  The Tasting (Fried) portion of the event was to say the least non existent. I was prepared to broaden my knowledge and tantalize my pallet with an assortment of chicken. That did not happen. There was a  cheese platter -which was nice but the advertisement says Fried Chicken.  I as well as many other guest were extremely disappointed. Hopefully the event planners will either change the advertisement or add Fried Chicken to the event in the future

originalText.text: I visited the space for a tasting event; the rooms were large and spacious but backed with people so it was difficult to maneuver around. The whole area had a nice ambiance with the lighting and all the people working there were nice and attentive. One thing I would change about the layout was where they had the coat check. Not a significant problem, but it was in a narrow area where people walked back and forth to get to the other room or wait for the bathroom etc, so it got crowded quickly just walking through. Overall, it was a nice space and you can hold many events with large crowds.
